Package shapes3d.path

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Path  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPath
    Defines the path that a tubular or extruded shape follows in 3D space.
    BCurve2D
    This class is used to represent a single Bezier curve of degree ≥ 2 in 2D space.
    BCurve3D
    This class is used to represent a single Bezier curve of degree ≥ 2 in 3D space.
    BSpline2D
    This class defines a Bezier spline in 2D space that passes through a set of given points (called knots).
    BSpline3D
    This class defines a Bezier spline in 3D space that passes through a set of given points (called knots).
    Linear
    Defines a straight line path between any 2 points in 2D space.
    Lissajous
    A path through 3D space based on the Lissajous curve.
    PathOrthogonal
    At any point along the s continuous curve in 2D space there is a single curve tangent line and two curve normals (orthogonals).
    PathOrthogonal.PathNormalAMC
    This implementation came from the Apache Maths Commons project.
    PathOrthogonal.PathNormalX
    Use the dot-product algorithm for the X axis
    PathOrthogonal.PathNormalY
    Use the dot-product algorithm for the Y axis
    PathOrthogonal.PathNormalZ
    Use the dot-product algorithm for the Z axis
    Ring
    Create a circular or elliptical path.
    Spiral
    This class represents a spiral or helical path.
